statements: SELECT type, COUNT(*) AS count FROM default:catalog GROUP BY type ORDER BY count

description: use all aggregate functions, no group by
statements: SELECT MIN(pricing.list) AS min, MAX(pricing.list) AS max, AVG(pricing.list) AS avg, SUM(pricing.list) AS sum, COUNT(pricing.list) AS count FROM default:catalog ORDER BY min

description: use all aggregate functions, this type with group by
statements: SELECT type, MIN(pricing.list) AS min, MAX(pricing.list) AS max, AVG(pricing.list) AS avg, SUM(pricing.list) AS sum, COUNT(pricing.list) AS count FROM default:catalog GROUP BY type ORDER BY min

description: use all aggregate functions, with group by and having
statements: SELECT type, MIN(pricing.list) AS min, MAX(pricing.list) AS max, AVG(pricing.list) AS avg, SUM(pricing.list) AS sum, COUNT(pricing.list) AS count FROM default:catalog GROUP BY type HAVING count(pricing.list) > 1 ORDER BY min
SELECT ARRAY_AGG(asin) AS agg FROM default:catalog ORDER BY agg
SELECT orderlines[1], count(*) AS count FROM default:orders GROUP BY orderlines[1] ORDER BY count
SELECT orderlines,  count(*) AS count FROM default:orders GROUP BY orderlines ORDER BY orderlines

SELECT details.director AS D, count(*) AS count FROM default:catalog WHERE ANY director IN details.director SATISFIES director END GROUP BY details.director HAVING ARRAY_LENGTH(details.director) > 1 ORDER BY D

SELECT title, SUM(dimensions.length), SUM(dimensions.width) FROM default:catalog WHERE dimensions.height > 0.5 AND ANY gen IN details.genre SATISFIES gen = "Thriller" END GROUP BY title HAVING SUM(dimensions.width) > 1 and SUM(dimensions.length) > 1 ORDER BY title

SELECT personal_details.state, profile_details.loyalty.membership_type, count(*) AS gold_members FROM default:user_profile GROUP BY personal_details.state, profile_details.loyalty.membership_type HAVING profile_details.loyalty.membership_type = "Gold" ORDER BY personal_details.state
SELECT profile_details.prefs.ui_theme, count(*) AS theme_usage FROM default:user_profile GROUP BY profile_details.prefs.ui_theme ORDER BY profile_details.prefs.ui_theme

description: test that distinct count works with group by
statements: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT job_title) AS distinct_title_count, join_yr FROM default:jobs GROUP BY join_yr ORDER BY distinct_title_count, join_yr

description: test that distinct array agg works with group by
statements: SELECT ARRAY_AGG(DISTINCT job_title) AS distinct_titles, join_yr FROM default:jobs GROUP BY join_yr ORDER BY distinct_titles, join_yr

description: test that distinct count and count work at the same time
statements: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT job_title) AS distinct_title_count, COUNT(job_title) AS title_count, join_yr FROM default:jobs GROUP BY join_yr ORDER BY distinct_title_count, join_yr

description: test that distinct array agg and array agg work at the same time
statements: SELECT ARRAY_AGG(DISTINCT job_title) AS distinct_titles, ARRAY_AGG(job_title) AS titles, join_yr FROM default:jobs GROUP BY join_yr ORDER BY distinct_titles, join_yr
